issue.title: Adding support for Android 12+ with Foreground Notification

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Added support for Android 12+ as current implementation throws a `ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException`. Removed the `Service` implementation & replaced it with `WorkManager`.

Also, `LeakCanaryProcess` will now check for any running or enqueued heap analyzing `Work` instead of checking for a running `Service`.

Fixes #2192

body:
I have to think a bit more about this. I'd rather avoid adding a dependency on WorkManager.

We could stop using a service and just run in a thread. That should work most of the time, but we'll lose work if the process is killed. This also won't work for people who want to run LeakCanary in a separate process. But honestly maybe we should just stop supporting that.
Another option is to just start a foreground service as soon as we start tracking refs, and until all refs are cleared. That might be mildly annoying though.

issue.title: Crash while dumping heap after MediaSession leak happens

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
### Description

I've found a crash that happened to me after triggering a known leak in my application.  I've loosely documented the leak and how the crash is triggered through [this StackOverflow question post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70178226/mediasession-is-leaking-in-audio-app-with-leakcanary-crash), but wanted to file the crash separately for completion's sake.  Also, it may bring about more visibility to my initial questions as well!

Here's the crash stacktrace: 
```
Fatal Exception: android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException: startForegroundService() not allowed due to mAllowStartForeground false: service com.mixhalo.mixhaloclient.debug/leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService
       at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:54)
       at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:50)
       at android.os.Parcel.readParcelable(Parcel.java:3333)
       at android.os.Parcel.createExceptionOrNull(Parcel.java:2420)
       at android.os.Parcel.createException(Parcel.java:2409)
       at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2392)
       at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2334)
       at android.app.IActivityManager$Stub$Proxy.startService(IActivityManager.java:5971)
       at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java)
       at leakcanary.ServiceWatcher$install$4$2.invoke(ServiceWatcher.kt:85)
       at java.lang.reflect.Proxy.invoke(Proxy.java:1006)
       at $Proxy3.startService()
       at android.app.ContextImpl.startServiceCommon(ContextImpl.java:1847)
       at android.app.ContextImpl.startForegroundService(ContextImpl.java:1823)
       at android.content.ContextWrapper.startForegroundService(ContextWrapper.java:779)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.startForegroundService(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:149)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.runAnalysis(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:141)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.dumpHeap(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:186)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:150)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.access$checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:29)
       at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger$scheduleRetainedObjectCheck$1.run(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:334)
       at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:938)
       at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
       at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:201)
       at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:288)
       at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:67)
```

### Steps to Reproduce

*NOTE:* I'll work on a sample application tomorrow to better showcase this scenario.

1. Open application
2. Start playing audio through the `MediaBrowserService`
3. Dismiss application from the app overview screen
4. Wait for about 10-15 seconds and wait for crash to happen

**Expected behavior:** LeakCanary doesn't crash and instead dumps the heap and shows if there's any potential leaks happening

### Version Information

* LeakCanary version: 2.7
* Android OS version: 12
* Gradle version: 7.0.2

### Additional Information

I should mention that if the application is quickly re-opened after closing it out from the app overview screen, the same session of the app will be opened and LeakCanary will detect the leaking object and not crash.  This extra steps have allowed to me gather the leak report found in the StackOverflow question from before.

body: Interesting, I'm not able to reproduce this with the sample app inside the LeakCanary repo.
Yes, I changed the target and did not manage to repro. I need someone to provide me with a sample app and scenario that reproduces this.

oh hey, running on my Pixel 6 did repro.

```
    android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException: startForegroundService() not allowed due to mAllowStartForeground false: service com.example.leakcanary/leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService
        at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:54)
        at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:50)
        at android.os.Parcel.readParcelable(Parcel.java:3333)
        at android.os.Parcel.createExceptionOrNull(Parcel.java:2420)
        at android.os.Parcel.createException(Parcel.java:2409)
        at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2392)
        at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2334)
        at android.app.IActivityManager$Stub$Proxy.startService(IActivityManager.java:5971)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at leakcanary.ServiceWatcher$install$4$2.invoke(ServiceWatcher.kt:93)
        at java.lang.reflect.Proxy.invoke(Proxy.java:1006)
        at $Proxy3.startService(Unknown Source)
        at android.app.ContextImpl.startServiceCommon(ContextImpl.java:1847)
        at android.app.ContextImpl.startForegroundService(ContextImpl.java:1823)
        at android.content.ContextWrapper.startForegroundService(ContextWrapper.java:779)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.startForegroundService(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:201)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.runAnalysis(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:193)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.dumpHeap(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:203)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:153)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.access$checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:33)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger$scheduleRetainedObjectCheck$1.run(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:354)
        at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:938)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
        at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:201)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:288)
        at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:67)
     Caused by: android.os.RemoteException: Remote stack trace:
        at com.android.server.am.ActiveServices.startServiceLocked(ActiveServices.java:691)
        at com.android.server.am.ActiveServices.startServiceLocked(ActiveServices.java:616)
        at com.android.server.am.ActivityManagerService.startService(ActivityManagerService.java:11839)
        at android.app.IActivityManager$Stub.onTransact(IActivityManager.java:2519)
        at com.android.server.am.ActivityManagerService.onTransact(ActivityManagerService.java:2498)
```

issue.title: New EventListener + HeapDumper APIs

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.title: Crash when there is a leak inside Android Bubble activity

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
### Description

Leak canary crashes if accessed through a Android Bubbles 
```
android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException: startForegroundService() not allowed due to mAllowStartForeground false: service com.app.newapp/leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService
        at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:54)
        at android.app.ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException$1.createFromParcel(ForegroundServiceStartNotAllowedException.java:50)
        at android.os.Parcel.readParcelable(Parcel.java:3333)
        at android.os.Parcel.createExceptionOrNull(Parcel.java:2420)
        at android.os.Parcel.createException(Parcel.java:2409)
        at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2392)
        at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:2334)
        at android.app.IActivityManager$Stub$Proxy.startService(IActivityManager.java:5971)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at leakcanary.ServiceWatcher$install$4$2.invoke(ServiceWatcher.kt:85)
        at java.lang.reflect.Proxy.invoke(Proxy.java:1006)
        at $Proxy3.startService(Unknown Source)
        at android.app.ContextImpl.startServiceCommon(ContextImpl.java:1847)
        at android.app.ContextImpl.startForegroundService(ContextImpl.java:1823)
        at android.content.ContextWrapper.startForegroundService(ContextWrapper.java:779)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.startForegroundService(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:149)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapAnalyzerService$Companion.runAnalysis(HeapAnalyzerService.kt:141)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.dumpHeap(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:186)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:150)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger.access$checkRetainedObjects(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:29)
        at leakcanary.internal.HeapDumpTrigger$scheduleRetainedObjectCheck$1.run(HeapDumpTrigger.kt:334)
        at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:938)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
        at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:201)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:288)
        at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:67)
     Caused by: android.os.RemoteException: Remote stack trace:
        at com.android.server.am.ActiveServices.startServiceLocked(ActiveServices.java:691)
        at com.android.server.am.ActiveServices.startServiceLocked(ActiveServices.java:616)
        at com.android.server.am.ActivityManagerService.startService(ActivityManagerService.java:11839)
        at android.app.IActivityManager$Stub.onTransact(IActivityManager.java:2519)
        at com.android.server.am.ActivityManagerService.onTransact(ActivityManagerService.java:2498)
```


### Steps to Reproduce

A leak inside the Bubble activity.

**Expected behavior:** No crash
### Version Information

* LeakCanary version: 2.7
* Android OS version: 12
* Gradle version: 6.7.1

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

body:
is that enough to upgrade the version of leakCanary from 2.7 to 2.8.1 and + ? or else there may be any code level changes that needs to be done on app layer? 

coz, i found that the HeapAnalyzerWorker.kt with the fix is available on v2.8
